intro: Eremosis baadii, commonly known as the Baadi's eremosis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, small, and often pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Its flowering period is usually during the rainy season, and it plays a minor role in local ecosystems despite its limited distribution. Due to habitat loss and overcollection, it is considered vulnerable in some areas.
